metadata.title: CVE-2022-1242 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Apport can be tricked into connecting to arbitrary sockets as the rootuser

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
apport-gtk - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
apport-kde - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
apport-noui - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
apport-retrace - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
apport-valgrind - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
dh-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
python3-apport - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
python3-problem-report - 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.11-0ubuntu27.24').
